subject: Web3
title: Dollar Dominance Through Stablecoins
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Dollar Dominance Through Stablecoins.

hook.text: Over 99% of stablecoins are pegged to the US dollar. Crypto accidentally reinforced dollar dominance worldwide.

buildup.text: People in Argentina, Turkey, and Nigeria buy dollar stablecoins to protect savings from local currency inflation.

discovery.text: Stablecoins give anyone with a smartphone access to dollar-denominated savings, bypassing local banking restrictions.

twist.text: Some governments view this as a threat. Dollar stablecoins drain demand for local currencies and weaken monetary control.

climax.text: Stablecoins are spreading the dollar to places US banks never reached. Digital dollarization is happening from the bottom up.

punchline.text: Crypto was supposed to replace the dollar. Stablecoins made it more dominant.

quiz.question: How do stablecoins affect global dollar dominance?
options: They extend dollar access worldwide, reinforcing its dominance
They have no effect on the dollar
